Key Match Events: Rachin Ravindra brought up his third World Cup century but it was in vain
Fakhar Zaman smashed an unbeaten 126 in 81 balls to keep Pakistan up with the DLS asking rate
Pakistan won by 21 runs using the DLS method
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan's decision to field first after winning the toss raised eyebrows on a flat wicket
Pakistan went without their two legspinners or Mohammad Nawaz
Babar Azam struggled for respite from any corner
Pakistan were fined 10% of their match fees for maintaining a slow over rate
Post-Match Reflections: Fakhar Zaman's century was a crucial moment in the match
Pakistan's win levels them on points with New Zealand and puts a semi-final berth within realistic grasp
Miscellaneous Highlights: Devon Conway and Ravindra had started brightly, and Pakistan found themselves turning to Iftikhar Ahmed's spin in the sixth over
Williamson nearly ran himself out three times while within touch of his century
Fakhar brought up his half-century with a late cut off Ish Sodhi off 39 balls
Williamson fatefully turned to Sodhi, who conceded 32 in the two overs he sent down, including two gigantic sixes off Fakhar
Others: Pakistan needed everything to go their way to have a snowball's chance in hell
Tim Southee and Santner were taken on by Fakhar
Rachin Ravindra's third century of the World Cup was in vain
The match was played under DLS method due to rain interruptions
